data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person who is facing forward always takes the first step. Someone who is facing around will always take the first step. The starting point is always facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Walking back into place is much harder that it would be returning the 4 steps from your initial destination. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 6 steps and take 4 steps, you’ll go back to step 1. Turn around and take 10 steps to go back to step 1. To return to step 1, you should take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow 1 step, you can return back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

It is only possible to turn 2 places in one. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you turn right after turning around, you will turn right. If you turn left after taking 7 steps, you will turn right again. So, the answer is Yes.

The second instruction is the same as the first instruction – take 4 steps, turn around, take 8 steps and take 2 steps. So, the answer is yes.

It takes steps to get from point A to point B. It takes 4 steps to get from point A to point B. It takes 6 steps to get from point A to point B. So, the answer is Yes.

The first phrase means to take 6 steps. The second phrase, to take 3, means taking 3 steps. The third phrase, to take 4, means to take 9 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, and take 1 step backward, you’re still going forward. If you always face forward, then you are taking 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You cannot turn backwards and go forwards at the same time. The first part of the steps to backward are repeated twice, so the whole process is repeated once. If you turn back, you haven't finished the previous step. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The instructions call for you to always face forward. The first steps are taken in order from left to right: 10 steps left, 3 steps left, 1 step left, 3 steps forward, 4 steps right. There are 2 ways that you can achieve this. The first way is to always face forward. The second way is to always take 1 step right. So, the answer is yes.
